page.title: 02 GAZETTEER
page.content:
This is a most interesting area,both scenically and in terms of human activity.The landscape varies from east to west mainly under the influence of geology and the River Otter.East Budleigh and Bicton Commons to the west form the highest land and the Otter and its extensive flood-plain on the east the lowest points. The land use is mainly agricultural with pasture in a belt along the river and arable towards the commons. East Budleigh is the largest and only village, Yettington is a hamlet and the remaining settlements are farms. Bicton House is now an Agricultural College and its grounds form Bicton Gardens Amusement Park. Hayes Barton and Otterton Mill are other tourist attractions. The area is pretty and has a wide social mix.
By A.Kain & J.Ross
